item.title: Adrienne add a quote by Nick Hornby
item.description: "All the books we own, both read and unread, are the fullest expression of self we have at our disposal. ... But with each passing year, and with each whimsical purchase, our libraries become more and more able to articulate who we are, whether we read the books or not." -- Nick Hornby

item.title: Adrienne add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "The world is quiet here." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Adrienne add a quote by Carlos María Domínguez
item.description: "To build up a library is to create a life. It's never just a random collection of books." -- Carlos María Domínguez

item.title: Adrienne add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "If one cannot enjoy reading a book over and over again, there is no use in reading it at all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Adrienne add a quote by William Styron
item.description: "A great book should leave you with many experiences, and slightly exhausted at the end. You live several lives while reading." -- William Styron

item.title: Adrienne add a quote by Anna Quindlen
item.description: "Books are the plane, and the train, and the road. They are the destination, and the journey. They are home." -- Anna Quindlen

item.title: Adrienne add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Never trust anyone who has not brought a book with them." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Adrienne add a quote by Sir Francis Bacon
item.description: "Some books should be tasted, some devoured, but only a few should be chewed and digested thoroughly." -- Sir Francis Bacon

item.title: Adrienne add a quote by Henry Ward Beecher
item.description: "Books are not made for furniture, but there is nothing else that so beautifully furnishes a house." -- Henry Ward Beecher

item.title: Adrienne add a quote by John Berry
item.description: "If your library is not "unsafe," it probably isn't doing its job." -- John Berry

item.title: Adrienne add a quote by Jane Smiley
item.description: "Many people, myself among them, feel better at the mere sight of a book." -- Jane Smiley

item.title: Adrienne add a quote by Betty Smith
item.description: "The world was hers for the reading." -- Betty Smith

item.title: Adrienne add a quote by Stéphane Mallarmé
item.description: "Everything in the world exists in order to end up as a book." -- Stéphane Mallarmé

item.title: Adrienne add a quote by Holbrook Jackson
item.description: "A good book is always on tap; it may be decanted and drunk a hundred times, and it is still there for further imbibement. " -- Holbrook Jackson

item.title: Adrienne add a quote by Diane Setterfield
item.description: "There are too many books in the world to read in a single lifetime; you have to draw the line somewhere." -- Diane Setterfield

item.title: Adrienne add a quote by Jules Verne
item.description: "We are of opinion that instead of letting books grow moldy behind an iron grating, far from the vulgar gaze, it is better to let them wear out by being read." -- Jules Verne
